contest-event.event-date: Oct. 6, 1973 D National Championship of Great Britain (Championship Section Final) National Championship of Great Britain (Championship Section Final) 1 Test Piece Contest National Championship of Great Britain (Finals) national-finals-championship-section European Championships The current Nationals contest began in 1900, but there was a previous 'Nationals' contest run 40 years earlier: Enderby Jackson's Great National Contest. Championship Freedom (Brass Band Symphony No. 1) Royal Albert Hall, Kensington, Kensington and Chelsea, Greater London, England, UK Wilfred Heaton's 'Contest Music' was originally selected as the test-piece, but replaced. The winning band was also presented with a Decca LP recording offer. The winning conductor was awarded a presentation score of the test piece. The Spotlight on Service was given to George Thompson. The Insignia of Honour was awarded to Bert Sullivan.
